description: From Middle English dewy, deuhy, from Old English dēawiġ, from Old English dēaw. Equivalent to dew +‎ y.

adjectives.description: dewy (comparative dewier or more dewy, superlative dewiest or most dewy)

examples: Synonyms: bedewed, rory; see also Thesaurus:bedewed
The dewy grass was too slick for football.

entries.meaning: Having the quality of bearing droplets of water.
examples: In the dewy fog, it was cold and damp.
Thy dewy looks sink in my breast
Thy gentle words stir poison there;
